subject: Business
title: Decision Fatigue in Organizations
description: A 60-second lesson on Decision Fatigue in Organizations.

hook.text: Judges grant parole at 65% in the morning and near 0% before lunch. Tired brains default to 'no.'

buildup.text: Decision fatigue means the quality of decisions deteriorates after making many in a row.

discovery.text: Organizations that require too many approvals exhaust decision-makers. Quality drops; speed disappears.

twist.text: Steve Jobs wore the same outfit daily to eliminate one decision. Bezos makes key decisions before 10 AM.

climax.text: The fix: reduce decision volume through policies, defaults, and delegation. Save energy for what matters.

punchline.text: Every small decision uses the same fuel as a big one.

quiz.question: How can organizations reduce decision fatigue?
options: Use defaults, policies, and delegation to reduce decision volume
Require every team member to approve every decision
Schedule all important meetings in the evening
